channel.title: Windows XP users cannot use my client
channel.description:
The title says it all. I've been asking around how to fix this for a day or so on several sites. I still haven't figured it out.
Here's the code that I give them to use for the run file: [code=java] @echo off java -cp bin -Xms512m -Xmx624m client 10 0 highmem members 32 pause[/code]
Here's the error they all get:
[IMG]http://i1094.photobucket.com/albums/i456/iz0mb1e/untitled-3.jpg[/img]

item.title: Windows XP users cannot use my client
item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:
@Resent wrote:

Here’s the WindowsXP code:

@echo off
java -Xmx512m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

Now click edit on the “Run Client” file and replace your current code with that. Basically it’s running their client off of a simple 32bit.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows XP users cannot use my client

i thought it was a open source? correct me if im wrong.

item.source: Windows XP users cannot use my client

item.title: Windows XP users cannot use my client
item.dc:creator: @iZombz iZombz
item.description:
@iZombz wrote:

[quote=“macca4g, post:2, topic:408543”]that is a cache error i used to have the same problem

it is saying the cache they are downloading cant find the mapsconfig.txt

rezip or rerar your cache and then re upload it or get them to download it manually

basically when u open your local disc and u see your cache it is not unzipping properly so this means that the maps config can not be found all u need to do is tell them to download it manually or fix your cache :)[/quote]

Would you mind helping me with that?

Read full topic
item.source: Windows XP users cannot use my client

item.title: Windows XP users cannot use my client
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

You zipped your cache’s folder. Zip the files inside the cache and try it.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows XP users cannot use my client

item.title: Windows XP users cannot use my client
item.dc:creator: @macca4g macca4g
item.description:
@macca4g wrote:

that is a cache error i used to have the same problem

it is saying the cache they are downloading cant find the mapsconfig.txt

rezip or rerar your cache and then re upload it or get them to download it manually

basically when u open your local disc and u see your cache it is not unzipping properly so this means that the maps config can not be found all u need to do is tell them to download it manually or fix your cache

Read full topic
